meanings.definition: To defeat or surpass in competition.
meanings.sent1: The cheetah was outcompeting the other animals in the race.
meanings.sent2: The company's innovative marketing strategy allowed it to outcompete its rivals.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was outcompeting the birds for the best spot to gather nuts.
meanings.sent4: The young entrepreneur was outcompeting the established businesses in the market.
meanings.sent5: The student studied diligently, outcompeting all others in the exam.

meanings.definition: To be more successful than others in a competitive situation.
meanings.sent1: The athlete trained hard to outcompete his opponents in the race.
meanings.sent2: The new restaurant quickly outcompeted the older ones in town.
meanings.sent3: The little ant was outcompeting the bigger ants in collecting food.
meanings.sent4: The startup company was outcompeting the industry giants with its innovative approach.
meanings.sent5: The team's strong teamwork allowed them to outcompete all other teams in the tournament.
